channel.title: Spring
channel.description: Level up your Java code and explore what Spring can do for you.

item.title: A Bootiful Podcast: JetBrains and Spring community legend Marco Behler
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded: hi, Spring fans! In this installment I have the privilege of talking to JetBrains legend Marco Behler

item.title: This Week in Spring - February 3rd, 2026
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! This week I'm in northern Europe. I went on the Vaadin cruise from Finland to Sweden, gave a talk on a boat, then arrived in Stockholm in time for the amazing JFokus 2026 event where I had the privilege yesterday of doing a deep dive with my pal James Ward on Spring AI and agentic patterns (some of which we also look at in this very roundup). Later today, I'm doing a talk introducing the new Spring Boot 4 support. Busy day, so let's dive right into this roundup!

  • Spring gRPC 1.0.2 available now
  • want your AI agents to be more intelligent? Check out this amazing new blog from the Spring AI team introducing Agent2Agent (A2A) support
  • In last week's episode of A Bootiful Podcast, I talked to Java developer advocate Billy Korando
  • Spring Cloud 2025.1.1 has been released
  • and yet another blog form the Spring AI team, this one announcing agent skills support
  • ... and this one introduces the subagent orchestration pattern with Spring AI
  • Spring Shell 4.0.1 is out
  • did you see InfoQ's Spring roundup?
  • Makin-san has a nice blog post on instrumenting a DataSource for observability
  • I know I've mentioned this before, but this is a Spring Boot-powered mind-mapping software and I like it

item.title: Spring Shell 4.0.1 is out!
item.dc:creator: fmbenhassine
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and all contributors, I am pleased to announce that Spring Shell 4.0.1 is now available from Maven Central!

What's New in Spring Shell 4.0.1

Spring Shell 4.0.1 is a patch release that addresses several issues reported by the community since the release of Spring Shell 4.0.0. This release includes important bug fixes and improvements to enhance the overall stability and performance of the framework.

You can find the complete list of changes in the 4.0.1 release notes.

Feedback

Many thanks to all contributors who made this release possible! We encourage you to try Spring Shell 4.0.1 out and provide your feedback on GitHub Issues and GitHub Discussions.

Spring Shell Home|Source on GitHub|Reference documentation

item.title: Spring gRPC 1.0.2 Available Now
item.dc:creator: onobc
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I'm happy to announce that Spring gRPC 1.0.2 maintenance release is available from Maven Central.

Please see the release notes for more details.

We want to take this opportunity to again thank all our users and contributors.

Project Page | GitHub
